result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott K. Meherg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443.00. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court sets the restitution in this case at $741.61 payable to the Waterloo Antiques Mall. The Court finds that the restitution in this matter has been paid.

--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence; THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE

--4 days credit for time already served given

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision upon request.

[ml] Case called at 4:45PM
[All appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Scott K. Meherg appears. Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears. ADA Garrett Johnson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies that the Defendant understands his right to be present in court during sentencing. He waives this right and the Court proceeds with Plea and Sentencing in this matter.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence; THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE
--4 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443.00. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision upon request.
The Court sets the restitution in this case at $741.61 payable to the Waterloo Antiques Mall. The Court finds that the restitution in this matter has been paid.
The Court notes that it may assess the restitution surcharge in this case at the request of the Clerk of Courts Office as it had processed restitution payments, but declines to assess the surcharge now.

recess 5:07PM

Defendant Scott K. Meherg does not appear. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court excuses the Defendant's non-appearance in court given that this case was called much later than it was scheduled for.
The Defense requests that this matter is prepared to resolved. The State indicates that this matter is aging and requests that this matter be set for Plea and Sentencing with Trial back ups.
The Court schedules a Plea and Sentencing date, indicating that a if there is not a resolution at the next hearing, then Trial dates will be set.

10:57 AM. Clerk - CRHI (Case was scheduled for Plea/Sent.)
Attorney Rumpf appears for Atty. Joseph M Ricker in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. 
Court and Counsel discuss in-custody status of this defendant.  ADA Shock notes that a Vinelink check showed that the defendant was in custody in Davenport, Iowa. 
State moves for issuance of a warrant. Defense requests that the matter be rescheduled by Zoom. 
Court authorizes issuance of a warrant but stays it for 2 weeks to allow Atty. De La Rosa time to establish where the defendant is in custody and make the arrangements to have the defendant appear by Zoom.

[ma] Case called at 1:18 PM 
Defendant Scott K. Meherg appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  Public Defender Joseph Ricker appears (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

After making inquiries of the parties regarding their ability to see and hear the proceedings, the Court finds that the Zoom videoconferencing connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant provides date of birth and updated address of: 520 Sheridan Rd. in Kenosha or Racine, Mr. Meherg is unsure of the city.
The Court directs Mr. Meherg to provide an updated mailing address by the end of week.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.


The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with condition:
--no presence at Waterloo Antiques Mall in Waterloo

recess 1:30 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/22/20 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 8/6/20 at 8:30am (via Zoom)
